definition: handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me

sentences.english: Students friends in the industry to find jobs equal to the task.
sentences.chinese: 業大學生朋友們在找工作時遊刃有餘。

sentences.english: By following that principle I have gotten lucky with changes time and time again.
sentences.chinese: 通過採用這樣的原則，我在面對變化時遊刃有餘。

sentences.english: Bill Clinton, former President of the United States in the international diplomatic arena is still comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 克林頓，美國前總統在國際外交舞臺依然遊刃有餘。

sentences.english: Loosening up the tightly regulated labor market to make it easier for firms to hire and fire helped.
sentences.chinese: 寬鬆的勞動力市場監管讓他們在就業市場遊刃有餘。

sentences.english: Chen Sui-born architect with the Ministry of Works about programmes to highly competent.
sentences.chinese: 建築師出身的陳穗建與工程部談起方案來遊刃有餘。

sentences.english: B: Do you know what his technique is that makes him so skilled?
sentences.chinese: 你知道他這樣遊刃有餘到底用的是什麼技巧呢？

sentences.english: Mary is neither clever nor stupid, but is good enough at her work.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗既不聰明也不笨，但應付工作遊刃有餘。

sentences.english: He navigates celebrity dinner galas like a seasoned politician.
sentences.chinese: 他遊刃有餘地參加名流晚宴，宛如政壇老將。

definition: lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
cultured and refined (idiom); gentle and cultivated
to remain calm in the face of events (idiom)
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
